alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 6:43PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Fergus, southwestern Blaine and east central Chouteau Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 642 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Geraldine, or 30 miles south of Big Sandy, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail, along with heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Iliad. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to minor localized flooding of roads, small creeks, and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
